reviews.review_text: New Taiwanese restaurant that just opened up in Marpole. The food tasted pretty good, I especially liked the calamari batter and seasoning as well as the noodle broth flavour. The appetizers are a bit on the pricey side but the rest of the menu seems to be priced like other similar restaurants. The service was good as well.
One of the best Taiwanese restaurants I have ever been to! Staff are amazing and very attentive. Food was absolutely delicious. I will definitely be coming back here. Highly recommend.

Marpole was in dire need of an authentic Taiwanese restaurant and Pearl House fills that gaping hole with delicious Taiwanese dishes. Their beef shank is simmered for 8 hours for a tender bite, their cabbage is infused with garlic, and their fried chicken nuggets are crispy and juicy. The prices are reasonable as well.
This restaurant is opened recently. I find it clean and tidy.  Food is delicious, price is reasonable and service is amazing.
Very good service. The boil vegetables was crispy. The soup noodle was soft and tender.

I didnt take any photos of the food but early last week I discovered this restaurant and went 3 days in a row after that, twice to dine and and once take out. The taiwanese food is authentic and so delicious. Ive had the sausage fried rice with egg which was good, the fried rice with egg is delicious. The clear broth beef noodle is incredible and the fried chicken is also so yummy I also had their spicy tofu and minced pork on rice and that was good. Ive also had their pig ears that were very authentic as well. No issues or complaints all 3 experiences. The only inconvenience is debit/cash only!
Strong flavors. We had the beef noodle soup and fried rice with fried chicken pieces. Food was at least a solid 8/10. Lychee drink was too sweet though but good watered down with tea
Its an authentic Taiwanese flavor and delicious!
It was my first time trying Taiwanese food, and I absolutely recommend this place. Foods were amazing, and service was perfect. I definitely would like to go there again
First time trying Taiwanese food, and it was the best experience! Food was delicious, the service was great! Highly recommended.
Normal everyday food but very well made and high quality. Service is great, attentive and nice attention to detail. Definitely my new favourite place.

This is perhaps as authentic of Taiwanese cuisine as you can get in town. The food was very delicious, and the service was great. Their winter melon drink just reminded me of my good old childhood memory.
Really good food and friendly service.  We didn t wait long for a table of four on a Sunday afternoon.
Awesome food, friendly service, and clean environment. Highly recommended!
Great service, great food. Couldnt ask for more. Highly recommend.
Very good food and service!
The best Taiwanese beef noodles!
Awesome staff and awesome food yumme
Good
Super authentic and delicious Taiwanese food, large portions and reasonable prices
Chicken drumstick rice is very good
The same taste is finally back!
Favorite silver wire roll

Pretty good Taiwanese food overall. Highly recommend the Taiwanese meatball which is a delicacy most restaurants don t offer. It is a tasty meatball made with pork and bamboo shoots and other good flavoured stuff wrapped in a chewy, bouncy, starchy coating similar to a mochi texture. It s almost like a giant dumpling and it is delicious. The beef noodle soups with thick noodle were just average because there was a thick layer of oil on the soup that was too greasy (if they could just skim off the oil it would be much better in my opinion so you can get to the tasty broth without so much oil). The noodles were also overdone to the point they would snap when you picked it up and they were mushy to eat. The noodles were so soft you couldn t even chew them. The deep fried pork intestines were very tasty but the portion was quite small for what you pay. The milk teas were average. The Taiwanese deep fried chicken nuggets tasted authentic.

Very solid new place, would be 5 stars if the combo value was just a bit better... The food quality is quite good, tasted fresh and not overly flavored. The fried rice was excellent, as was the popcorn chicken and calamari. The 2-item combo would have been great if they just threw in a bowl of plain rice, instead of just giving basically $1 off two items. The daily meal combo needed $3 extra for a drink, which IMHO isnt much of a deal but maybe Im just too cheap... :of Overall, very glad they are here and will go back again. Kid-friendliness: Lots of families with young children dining here. Friendly staff and quick service.
Good flavor, okay portion sizes. Nice bright space with comfortable spacing between tables.
Most authentic Taiwanese beef noodles in town!

When this restaurant was still in Burnaby 20 years ago, my friends and I used to drive a long way to eat there because it was probably the only place where we could truly taste authentic Taiwanese food. A few days ago, I heard from a friend that this restaurant was opening in Vancouver, and we were filled with excitement. On the day of their official opening, to avoid the crowded crowd, we arrived at five oclock. The restaurants decor is simple, but the advertising slogans and pictures on the walls are quite interesting. We ordered some Taiwanese snacks that we had been longing for, including TW Meatball W Pork Bamboo Shoot, Deep Fried Boneless Chicken Thigh Rice, Spicy Pork Ear Slice, and MARINATED BAMBOO SHOOTS. All the dishes still retained the authentic Taiwanese style and flavor. We all enjoyed our meal. When it was time to pay, because they were newly opened, they were selling a Super Value Coupon Book, buy 50 get 50. Each five-dollar voucher came with a note: $5 Vouchers can only be used per person per transaction. I even asked the staff at that time how to use them. However, to our surprise, when we went to eat there again yesterday, the staff insisted from start to finish that the three of us could only use two five-dollar vouchers. This statement completely contradicted the clear and straightforward rule: $5 Vouchers can only be used per person per transaction. When we asked the staff for an explanation, she said, We have always done it this way. Always? You just opened recently. We feel this is a deceptive practice and are very disappointed. We hope this company can provide a reasonable explanation. Note: Thank you, owner , for such a quick response and for resolving our concerns so clearly. I believe excellent quality and honest treatment of customers are important driving forces for a prosperous business.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Candy, Sorry for your unpleasant experience. We have corrected the usage of the redemption of $5 vouchers. If you are still unhappy about the redemptions, we are happy to refund your coupon book. Thank you for letting us know your experience. Below are the new guidelines for redemption. Dear customers, thank you all for your enthusiastic support and love.   All Pearl House vouchers have been sold out.   Due to possible unclear markings on the voucher cover, causing confusion in usage, we deeply apologize.   Here we provide instructions for use . We appreciate your understanding for any inconvenience.   The entire Pearl House team extends their gratitude to you! How to use the gift voucher: 1: The $10 gift voucher and the $5 gift voucher cannot be used together. 2: There is no limit on the number of redemptions for the $10 gift certificate 3: Each person can only use one $5 coupon per order (4 people can redeem 4 coupons for $5 when dining) 4: If you take out, you can only redeem one piece for $5. 5: Gift vouchers do not give change and cannot be exchanged for cash. 6: The store reserves the right to make changes Gift Voucher Usage: 1: $10 gift vouchers cannot be used in conjunction with $5 gift vouchers. 2: There is no limit to the number of $10 gift vouchers that can be redeemed. 3: Each person can only use one $5 gift voucher per order (4 people dining can redeem 4 $5 vouchers). 4: For takeout orders, only one $5 voucher can be redeemed. 5: Gift vouchers have no cash value and no change will be given. 6: The store reserves the right to make changes.

If you are still unhappy about the redemptions, we are happy to refund your coupon book. Thank you for letting us know your experience. Below are the new guidelines for redemption. Dear customers, thank you all for your enthusiastic support and love.   All Pearl House vouchers have been sold out.   Due to possible unclear markings on the voucher cover, causing confusion in usage, we deeply apologize.   Here we provide instructions for use. We appreciate your understanding for any inconvenience.   The entire Pearl House team extends their gratitude to you! 1: $10   $5 2: $10 3: $5            4        4 $5 4:           $5 5: 6: Gift Voucher Usage: 1: $10 gift vouchers cannot be used in conjunction with $5 gift vouchers. 2: There is no limit to the number of $10 gift vouchers that can be redeemed. 3: Each person can only use one $5 gift voucher per order (4 people dining can redeem 4 $5 vouchers). 4: For takeout orders, only one $5 voucher can be redeemed. 5: Gift vouchers have no cash value and no change will be given. 6: The store reserves the right to make changes.

reviews.review_text: Slow service, waiters were asking the cashier what they need to do and one of them said it feels like it is a mess.  There were at least 5 people working in the dinning room.  I called for take out, it took 30 mins for pick up.  Most of the table are full but customers were not eating, properly waiting for food.  Average close to $20/person.  Cash or debit only which is not a good idea for Vancouver West.  Hard to find parking street parking only.  I was here on the first week of soft opening.  I will give a chance again later when its settle down.
Newly opened authentic Taiwanese food.  A little bit expensive and portion.  Hope the inflation goes down to bring the price down.  It is not bubble tea place as not much drink choices.
The fuel consumption smell is too strong, the vegetables are delicious, overall I am a little disappointed
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your valuable advice. We will improve.

reviews.review_text: Beef noodles lose their previous level Chicken leg rice is delicious Fried rice has very poor CP value

The food was awesome and that was the reason we bought a few of their gift certificates. While buying them, they did mention there were exceptions on using the $5 certificate that its limited to 2 per table, but no limitations on the $10 ones. However today after eating in, I was just told that you cannot use the $10 certificate along with the $5 ones? So either you use two $5 or unlimited $10. This was never mentioned when we bought the certificates otherwise we wouldnt have bought so much. Kid-friendliness: Bowls and spoon and forks provided
Feel like lots of MSG on the dishes, my throat is burning even after 10 hours after meal.  My wife and I have had the same issue.  Second visit in a month but we are not going back to try again

This is my second visit to a new store. This time I ordered dry noodles, egg fried rice and dried beans and kelp. -Dry noodles, the sauce is too sweet and makes you feel tired after eating half of it -Egg fried rice, there is no gas in the pot and the rice is too wet Both kelp and dried beans are fine

The restaurant was quiet.  The male server in his late fifties was very rude and had a tantrum.  He was coughing frequently.  I wanted to order the half beef and half tendon noodles.  He said that they didn t have it.  Instead he was trying to upsell me to the beef short rib noodles, which was more expensive.  The beef short rib was fine.  However, I didn t like this restaurant s business practices overall.  I would not recommend this restaurant. I am 100 percent certain that it was a male server in his late fifties (probably the owner).  Restaurant is correct and recognizable on Granville St.  The storefront has a very large sign that says  Pearl House Restaurant .
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi, there is no  fifty years old  server in our restaurant and most of our servers are female. We only have ONE male server who is around late twenties . Are you sure you got the right restaurant?

reviews.review_text: Will not recommend for sure! Ordered take out and missing some order, they asked me to go back and get the food myself which I live far away... doesnt even say sorry?? eventually I didnt get either food or money back and shame on the poor service. I wont say the food is good, theres more better options in town!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Updates: After our investigation, we were sure that we did not missed any items for our Togo orders yesterday. Just want to confirm with you, did you place Togo order at our restaurant? We are   Pearl House Restaurant  on Granville St Vancouver. Hi, sorry to hear that we missed your order. Can you kindly tell us which location you placed your order? Also we would like to know which items we had missed? Please give us a call back at 6046206699 or kindly come to our restaurant directly. Our location is at 7994 Granville St Vancouver. Thank you!

reviews.review_text: If you are going to limit the number of $5 coupons you can use, you should have made that clear in your promotional materials. You should not change the terms of your promotion after the fact, much less tell your customers that they misunderstood the rules. Nowhere does it say you can only use maximum two $5 coupons. One per customer per transactions should mean exactly that. The food was just okay, but unfortunately I have to come back again to use up all the coupons. Shady business practice.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hello, We apologize for any confusion caused by the explanation on the cover of each voucher. Its possible that our labeling wasnt clear enough. We apologize for any inconvenience caused to you.
